intro: Altensteinia pterostyloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved altensteinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets and white ray florets, typically blooming in the summer months. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
